etymologies: late Middle English: dialect variant of obsolete fane ‘banner’, of Germanic origin

definitions: a broad blade attached to a rotating axis or wheel which pushes or is pushed by wind or water and forms part of a machine or device such as a windmill, propeller, or turbine.
shortDefinitions: broad blade attached to rotating axis or wheel which pushes or is pushed by wind or water

definitions: the flat part on either side of the shaft of a feather.
shortDefinitions: flat part on either side of shaft of feather

definitions: a broad, flat projecting surface designed to guide the motion of a projectile, such as a feather on an arrow or a fin on a torpedo.
shortDefinitions: broad, flat projecting surface designed to guide motion of projectile, such as feather on arrow or fin on torpedo
